intro: Dicalix spicatus, commonly known as the spicate dicalix, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pale yellow to white flowers that are typically arranged in spicate inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Dicalix spicatus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open woodland or savanna habitats.
